thread.title: Utah video: Hobbs told team the last play would come down to him — and it did
thread.title_full: Utah Utes video: Hobbs told team the last play would come down to him — and it did | Deseret News

author: Carter Williams
title: Utah video: Hobbs told team the last play would come down to him — and it did
text:
Before Utah cornerback Boobie Hobbs broke up California quarterback Jared Goff's pass to help No. 5 Utah escape with a 30-24 win over the No. 23 Bears, Hobbs turned to his teammates and made a bold prediction.
Upcoming 20 Secs More Coverage Dykes, Goff give Utes' defense credit for five picks Utes pick off Cal's Goff four times in first half SALT LAKE CITY — Before Utah cornerback Boobie Hobbs broke up California quarterback Jared Goff's pass to help No. 5 Utah escape with a 30-24 win over the No. 23 Bears, Hobbs turned to his teammates and made a bold prediction.
"I told everybody — I said, "the last play is going to come down to me and I'm going to get a pick-6," Hobbs said, "but I played it safe and batted it down. But it was a great overall team win."
Goff goes back to pass on fourth down, Boobie breaks it up! Defense holds once more, Utes win 30-24! #goutes http://t.co/fZieCKMe9k
— Utah Athletics (@utahathletics) October 11, 2015 Hobbs may not have ended the game with an interception, but the Utes secondary combined for four of five interceptions and two pass breakups, while safety Tevin Carter quietly led the team with nine tackles.
The Utes improved to 5-0 on the year and are now the lone remaining undefeated team in the Pac-12 Conference this season.
Hobbs added he believes the Utes have done enough to get the credit they have received of late.
"We feel like we're the No. 1 team," he said. "We just want to show the world that we can play with the Alabamas, the LSUs because we've got the guys and we've got great talent."
Check more of Utah's post game press conference in the video above.
